candidates.title: Release v1.0.0
candidates.body: Inspired by a conversation with @Dekkonot, I did some clean up work today and decided to finally cut a 1.0.0 release for `irc`. This library has been battle-tested for a long time at this point, and it's unlikely that I will meaningfully change the API going forward (which was the main reason we were still holding on to that `0.x.x` status). If the API is forced to change because of tokio in the future, so be it, but hopefully we can maintain compatibility going forward (especially in light of the fact that this library really is under passive maintenance at this point since I am not using IRC for anything in my day-to-day life anymore).

candidates.title: Bump dependencies, set rust-version, and some more maintenance work
candidates.body:
Reason for this change is that I noticed that the `irc` crate was the sole cause in my dependency graph for pulling in some old dependencies (`parking_lot` among others). Some dependencies had CVEs specified for versions which were inside of their minimal ranges. So I went ahead and ran a `cargo upgrade --workspace` here.

I used a tool which tried to build and detect the MSRV and updated rust-version. It also sorted the fields, as they are specified in the Cargo documentation. Hope this i OK, otherwise I'll pull it back.

Since [features need to be additive](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/features.html#feature-unification), I've made it so that if both `tls-rust` and `tls-native` are activated, only `tls-rust` will be used. If you want this flipped, please tell me.

Finally I've added a Github workflow file, which performs most checks (including testing for MSRV). But I haven't ported any integration tests yet. So if you want to keep running them on Travis that is OK by me. [You can see the run here](https://github.com/udoprog/irc/actions).

candidates.title: Reconfigure chrono to remove CVE-2020-26235/RUSTSEC-2020-0159
candidates.body: This is similiar to #238 but instead reconfigures chrono to not use time 0.1

candidates.title: New option: dangerously_accept_invalid_certs
candidates.body:
This patch adds an option to dangerously ignore all ceritificate verifications. This option must be used with extreme caution and should only be used as a last resort.

Closes #209, #230

Co-authored-by: Hyeon Kim <simnalamburt@gmail.com>

CC @quite

candidates.title: Upgrade to Tokio 1.0
candidates.body:
I've had to pull in `pin-project`, because types like `Sleep` no longer implements `Unpin`. Meaning we should perform sound projections to use them somehow.

Other than that, there should be no major changes.

candidates.title: Enable 'futures-util/alloc' feature
candidates.body: `futures-util` requires its `alloc` feature to be enabled to use `SplitSink` and `SplitStream`, and since `default-features` is set to `false`, we need to enable it manually.

candidates.title: Bump to Tokio 0.3.0 and clean up a few dependencies
candidates.body:
Not a ton of changes this release. Definitely not as many as `0.2` 🎉 

Removed dependencies:
* `futures-channel`
* `pin-utils` - seems to no longer used, and tokio comes with [tokio::pin](https://docs.rs/tokio/0/tokio/macro.pin.html) now.

candidates.title: Bump tokio-rustls, tokio-socks, webpki-roots, parking_lot
candidates.body: Subj (all of these are backward compatible for irc)

candidates.title: Release 0.14!
candidates.body:
Fixes #205 and #193 by releasing irc and irc-proto 0.14!
It's a big release with us coming up to tokio 0.2.

candidates.title: feature: add rustls support
candidates.body:
Continuity of https://github.com/aatxe/irc/pull/151

- Rename SSL as TLS
- Set TLS as a feature:
-- Provide 2 TLS backends via features: `tls-native` and `tls-rust`.
- Does not expose `use_tls` from `config.rs` if TLS is disabled:
-- We should prefer a compile error instead of a fake `config.use_tls()` which always return false. Another alternative may be to put an `unimplemented!()` macro.

candidates.title: feature: Proxy Support
candidates.body:
Add a simple SOCKS5 proxy support with [tokio-socks](https://crates.io/crates/tokio-socks).

We must enable the `proxy` feature:
```rust
let config = Config {
    ...
    proxy_type: Some(ProxyType::Socks5),
    proxy_server: Some("127.0.0.1".to_owned()),
    proxy_port: Some(1080),
    ..Default::default()
};
```

Also, set `use_ssl` to `true` by default - avoiding MTIM attacks because of misconfigurations.

candidates.title: Upgrade bytes to match irc-proto
candidates.body: This means there's no more bytes mis-match between irc and irc-proto/tokio. I'm looking into other packages as well.

candidates.title: Properly declare required tokio-util features
candidates.body: Fixes #194

candidates.title: Make serde and toml optional
candidates.body: This is an experimental PR meant to drop serde/toml if they are disabled in the features. Unfortunately, this means renaming features (if we want them consistent) because the feature name toml cannot be used (as there's a package with the same name).

candidates.title: Switch to modern error handling
candidates.body:
This switches error handling from `failure` to `std::error::Error`, supported by [`thiserror`](https://docs.rs/thiserror).

The new equivalent of `failure::Error` is `anyhow::Error`, so we use this for tests.

candidates.title: First stab at bumping the project to tokio 0.2
candidates.body:
Sorry, this is a big change. But that's kinda expected :/

Related #182 

Non-exhaustive list of changes:
* Bumped edition to 2018.
* Dropped the use of `ClientExt` in favor if tiny bit of duplication in `ClientState` and macros.
* Removed `Client` trait and renamed `IrcClient` to `Client`.
* `PackedIrcClient` no longer exists.
* Renamed `error::IrcError` to `error::Error`.
* Removed all things associated with the reactor.
* `ClientStream` drives the stream for outgoing messages by default, unless it has been taken from the `Client` through `Client::outgoing`.
* You can access a thread-safe sender through `Client::sender`, which uses the outgoing queue for sending messages.
* Switched mutexes and locks to use [`parking_lot`](https://github.com/Amanieu/parking_lot).
* Updated all examples to use `#[tokio::main]` and tests to use `#[tokio::test]`.

#### TODO
* Commented out a test, since it requires more complex interaction than what is currently usable.
* ~~Commented out configuration tests since I couldn't run them locally (Windows dev environment).~~
* Burst-based rate limiter has not been ported yet.

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13.6.
candidates.body: This fixes bugs in the color stripping code and otherwise updates dependencies.

candidates.title: Upgrade native-tls and tokio-tls to 0.2
candidates.body:
This should fix builds for systems with OpenSSL 1.1.1.

[OpenSSL Issue](https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl/issues/994)

candidates.title: Fix deprecated codes
candidates.body:
- Update `log` crate to the latest version.
 - Replace `tokio_io::codec` to `tokio_codec` crate.
 - Fix some compiler warnings (might be conflict with #145)

candidates.title: Migrated to `tokio` handleless runtime with `impl Future` result types.
Finalize 0.13.5 release.
candidates.body:
Finalize 0.13.5 release.

Contents:
- Moved input sanitation into `IrcCodec` to prevent problematic parsing round-trips.
- Added regression tests for #128 which inspired the above change.

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13.4 release.
candidates.body:
Finalize 0.13.4 release.

Contents:
* Changed ping logic to eliminate a rare panic under heavy load. (fixes #120)

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13.3 release.
candidates.body:
Finalize 0.13.3 release.

Contents:

- Replaced a panic when `alt_nicks` is exhausted with proper error handling.
- Added additional popular response codes from various IRCds.
- Improved documentation for `Response` as part of #106.
- Fixed #115 where cleanly closed connections could cause `IrcReactor`s to run forever.
- Improved `README.md` and added `CONTRIBUTING.md` for contributor guidelines.

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13.2 release.
candidates.body: Fixed the regression in 0.13 from #112. This release pulls 0.13.1 and 0.13.0 since they break all (or almost all) existing code.

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13.1 release
candidates.body: Missed the code in the README when the names changed from IrcServer to IrcClient.

candidates.title: Finalize 0.13 release.
candidates.body:
Finalize 0.13 release.

Contents:

- A new reactor API that should dramatically improve error handling and multiserver support, while hiding a lot of the tokio details for the average user.
- Renamed all the types containing `Server` to `Client` to resolve a long-standing confusion over naming.
- Migrated from `error-chain` to `failure` again to improve error handling.
- Added `Debug` derivations for `irc::client` types.

candidates.title: Replace rustc-serialize with serde
candidates.body:
rustc-serialize is deprecated.

Fixes #84.

chosen_pr.title: Bump dependencies, set rust-version, and some more maintenance work
chosen_pr.body:
Reason for this change is that I noticed that the `irc` crate was the sole cause in my dependency graph for pulling in some old dependencies (`parking_lot` among others). Some dependencies had CVEs specified for versions which were inside of their minimal ranges. So I went ahead and ran a `cargo upgrade --workspace` here.

I used a tool which tried to build and detect the MSRV and updated rust-version. It also sorted the fields, as they are specified in the Cargo documentation. Hope this i OK, otherwise I'll pull it back.

Since [features need to be additive](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/features.html#feature-unification), I've made it so that if both `tls-rust` and `tls-native` are activated, only `tls-rust` will be used. If you want this flipped, please tell me.

Finally I've added a Github workflow file, which performs most checks (including testing for MSRV). But I haven't ported any integration tests yet. So if you want to keep running them on Travis that is OK by me. [You can see the run here](https://github.com/udoprog/irc/actions).
